verses.text: The heavens declare the glory of God; And the firmament sheweth his handywork.
Day unto day uttereth speech, And night unto night sheweth knowledge.
\add There is\add* no speech nor language, \add Where\add* their voice is not heard.
Their line is gone out through all the earth, And their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,
Which \add is\add* as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, \add And\add* rejoiceth as a strong \add man\add* to run a race.
His going forth \add is\add* from the end of the heaven, And his circuit unto the ends of it: And there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.
The law of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* perfect, converting the soul: The testimony of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* sure, making wise the simple.
The statutes of the \sc Lord\sc* \add are\add* right, rejoicing the heart: The commandment of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* pure, enlightening the eyes.
The fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* clean, enduring for ever: The judgments of the \sc Lord\sc* \add are\add* true \add and\add* righteous altogether.
More to be desired \add are they\add* than gold, yea, than much fine gold: Sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
Moreover by them \add is\add* thy servant warned: \add And\add* in keeping of them \add there is\add* great reward.
Who can understand \add his\add* errors? Cleanse thou me from secret \add faults\add*.
Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous \add sins;\add* Let them not have dominion over me: Then shall I be upright, And I shall be innocent from \add the\add* great transgression.
Let the words of my mouth, And the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O \sc Lord\sc*, my strength, and my redeemer.
